description: Uploaded by https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/runbooks/-/jobs/4329632978 at Mon May 22 23:31:11 UTC 2023

panels.description: Apdex is a measure of requests that complete within a tolerable period of time for the service. Higher is better.

seriesOverrides.alias: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

targets.legendFormat: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

panels.title: ops-gitlab-net Service Apdex

targets.expr:
sum(
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_1h{env="ops",environment="ops",monitor="global",type="ops-gitlab-net"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_5m{env="ops",environment="ops",monitor="global",type="ops-gitlab-net"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="ops-gitlab-net"})))),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_1h{env="ops",environment="ops",monitor="global",type="ops-gitlab-net"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="ops-gitlab-net"})))),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_30m{env="ops",environment="ops",monitor="global",type="ops-gitlab-net"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="ops-gitlab-net"})))),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_6h{env="ops",environment="ops",monitor="global",type="ops-gitlab-net"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="ops-gitlab-net"})))),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: Error rates are a measure of unhandled service exceptions per second. Client errors are excluded when possible. Lower is better

seriesOverrides.alias: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

targets.legendFormat: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

panels.title: ops-gitlab-net Service Error Ratio

targets.expr:
sum (
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{env="ops",environment="ops",monitor="global",type="ops-gitlab-net"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{env="ops",environment="ops",monitor="global",type="ops-gitlab-net"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="ops-gitlab-net"})),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{env="ops",environment="ops",monitor="global",type="ops-gitlab-net"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="ops-gitlab-net"})),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_30m{env="ops",environment="ops",monitor="global",type="ops-gitlab-net"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="ops-gitlab-net"})),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_6h{env="ops",environment="ops",monitor="global",type="ops-gitlab-net"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="ops-gitlab-net"})),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.
panels.title: ops-gitlab-net Service RPS - Requests per Second

panels.title: goserver SLI RPS - Requests per Second

panels.content:
### Description

This SLI monitors all Gitaly GRPC requests in aggregate, excluding the OperationService.
GRPC failures which are considered to be the "server's fault" are counted as errors.
The apdex score is based on a subset of GRPC methods which are expected to be fast.



### Observability Tools

* [üìñ Kibana: Gitaly logs](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/discover?_a=(columns:!(json.hostname,json.grpc.method,json.grpc.request.glProjectPath,json.grpc.code,json.grpc.time_ms),filters:!((meta:(key:json.type,params:'ops-gitlab-net',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type:(query:'ops-gitlab-net',type:phrase))))),index:'AW5F1OHTiGcMMNRn84Di')&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [üìñ Kibana: Gitaly slow request logs](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/discover?_a=(columns:!(json.hostname,json.grpc.method,json.grpc.request.glProjectPath,json.grpc.code,json.grpc.time_ms),filters:!((meta:(key:json.type,params:'ops-gitlab-net',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type:(query:'ops-gitlab-net',type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.msg,params:unary,type:phrase),query:(match:(json.msg:(query:unary,type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.grpc.time_ms,params:(gte:1000),type:range),query:(range:(json.grpc.time_ms:(gte:1000))))),index:'AW5F1OHTiGcMMNRn84Di',sort:!(!(json.grpc.time_ms,desc)))&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [üìñ Kibana: Gitaly failed request logs](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/discover?_a=(columns:!(json.hostname,json.grpc.method,json.grpc.request.glProjectPath,json.grpc.code,json.grpc.time_ms),filters:!((meta:(key:json.type,params:'ops-gitlab-net',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type:(query:'ops-gitlab-net',type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.grpc.code,negate:!t,params:OK,type:phrase),query:(match:(json.grpc.code:(query:OK,type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:exists,type:json.grpc.code,value:exists),query:(exists:(field:json.grpc.code)))),index:'AW5F1OHTiGcMMNRn84Di')&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [üìà Kibana: Gitaly requests](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/visualize/create?type=line&indexPattern=AW5F1OHTiGcMMNRn84Di&_a=(filters:!((meta:(key:json.type,params:'ops-gitlab-net',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type:(query:'ops-gitlab-net',type:phrase))))),query:(language:kuery,query:''),vis:(aggs:!((enabled:!t,id:'1',params:(),schema:metric,type:count),(enabled:!t,id:'2',params:(drop_partials:!t,extended_bounds:(),field:json.time,interval:auto,min_doc_count:1,scaleMetricValues:!f,timeRange:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}'),useNormalizedEsInterval:!t),schema:segment,type:date_histogram))))&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [üìà Kibana: Gitaly failed requests](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/visualize/create?type=line&indexPattern=AW5F1OHTiGcMMNRn84Di&_a=(filters:!((meta:(key:json.type,params:'ops-gitlab-net',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type:(query:'ops-gitlab-net',type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.grpc.code,negate:!t,params:OK,type:phrase),query:(match:(json.grpc.code:(query:OK,type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:exists,type:json.grpc.code,value:exists),query:(exists:(field:json.grpc.code)))),query:(language:kuery,query:''),vis:(aggs:!((enabled:!t,id:'1',params:(),schema:metric,type:count),(enabled:!t,id:'2',params:(drop_partials:!t,extended_bounds:(),field:json.time,interval:auto,min_doc_count:1,scaleMetricValues:!f,timeRange:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}'),useNormalizedEsInterval:!t),schema:segment,type:date_histogram))))&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))

panels.title: puma SLI RPS - Requests per Second

panels.content:
### Description

Aggregation of most web requests that pass through the puma to the GitLab rails monolith.
Healthchecks are excluded.



### Observability Tools

* [üìñ Kibana: Puma logs](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/discover?_a=(columns:!(json.status,json.method,json.meta.caller_id,json.meta.feature_category,json.path,json.request_urgency,json.duration_s,json.target_duration_s),filters:!((meta:(key:json.subcomponent,negate:!t,params:graphql_json,type:phrase),query:(match:(json.subcomponent:(query:graphql_json,type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.type.keyword,params:default,type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type.keyword:(query:default,type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.type,params:'ops-gitlab-net',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type:(query:'ops-gitlab-net',type:phrase))))),index:'7092c4e2-4eb5-46f2-8305-a7da2edad090')&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))

panels.title: Details

panels.description: Apdex is a measure of requests that complete within a tolerable period of time for the service. Higher is better.

seriesOverrides.alias: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

targets.legendFormat: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

panels.title: workhorse SLI Apdex

targets.expr:
sum(
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_1h{component="workhorse",env="ops",environment="ops",monitor="global",type="ops-gitlab-net"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_5m{component="workhorse",env="ops",environment="ops",monitor="global",type="ops-gitlab-net"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="workhorse",monitor="global",type="ops-gitlab-net"})))),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_1h{component="workhorse",env="ops",environment="ops",monitor="global",type="ops-gitlab-net"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="workhorse",monitor="global",type="ops-gitlab-net"})))),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_30m{component="workhorse",env="ops",environment="ops",monitor="global",type="ops-gitlab-net"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="workhorse",monitor="global",type="ops-gitlab-net"})))),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_6h{component="workhorse",env="ops",environment="ops",monitor="global",type="ops-gitlab-net"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="workhorse",monitor="global",type="ops-gitlab-net"})))),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: Error rates are a measure of unhandled service exceptions per second. Client errors are excluded when possible. Lower is better

seriesOverrides.alias: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

targets.legendFormat: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

panels.title: workhorse SLI Error Ratio

targets.expr:
sum (
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_1h{component="workhorse",env="ops",environment="ops",monitor="global",type="ops-gitlab-net"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_5m{component="workhorse",env="ops",environment="ops",monitor="global",type="ops-gitlab-net"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="workhorse",monitor="global",type="ops-gitlab-net"})),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_1h{component="workhorse",env="ops",environment="ops",monitor="global",type="ops-gitlab-net"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="workhorse",monitor="global",type="ops-gitlab-net"})),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_30m{component="workhorse",env="ops",environment="ops",monitor="global",type="ops-gitlab-net"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="workhorse",monitor="global",type="ops-gitlab-net"})),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_6h{component="workhorse",env="ops",environment="ops",monitor="global",type="ops-gitlab-net"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="workhorse",monitor="global",type="ops-gitlab-net"})),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.
panels.title: workhorse SLI RPS - Requests per Second

panels.content:
### Description

Aggregation of most web requests that pass through workhorse, monitored via the HTTP interface.
Excludes health, readiness and liveness requests. Some known slow requests, such as HTTP uploads,
are excluded from the apdex score.



### Observability Tools

* [üìñ Kibana: Workhorse logs](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/discover?_a=(columns:!(json.method,json.remote_ip,json.status,json.uri,json.duration_ms),filters:!((meta:(key:json.type.keyword,params:default,type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type.keyword:(query:default,type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.type,params:'ops-gitlab-net',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type:(query:'ops-gitlab-net',type:phrase))))),index:'a4f5b470-edde-11ea-81e5-155ba78758d4')&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [üìñ Kibana: Workhorse slow request logs](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/discover?_a=(columns:!(json.method,json.remote_ip,json.status,json.uri,json.duration_ms),filters:!((meta:(key:json.type.keyword,params:default,type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type.keyword:(query:default,type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.type,params:'ops-gitlab-net',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type:(query:'ops-gitlab-net',type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.duration_ms,params:(gte:10000),type:range),query:(range:(json.duration_ms:(gte:10000))))),index:'a4f5b470-edde-11ea-81e5-155ba78758d4',sort:!(!(json.duration_ms,desc)))&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))

panels.title: Details
Estimated p95 workhorse Latency - per route
Apdex attribution for workhorse Latency - per route

panels.description:
Kubernetes containers are allocated a share of CPU. When this is exhausted, the container may be thottled.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard, pod, container) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      sum by (environment, tier, type, stage, shard, pod, container) (
        rate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="ops",environment="ops",type="ops-gitlab-net"}[5m])
      )
      /
      sum by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard, pod, container) (
        container_spec_cpu_quota:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="ops",environment="ops",type="ops-gitlab-net"}
        /
        container_spec_cpu_period:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="ops",environment="ops",type="ops-gitlab-net"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_container_cpu component saturation: Kube Container CPU Utilization

panels.description:
Records the total anonymous (unevictable) memory utilization for containers for this
service, as a percentage of the memory limit as configured through Kubernetes.

This is computed using the container's resident set size (RSS), as opposed to
kube_container_memory which uses the working set size. For our purposes, RSS is the
better metric as cAdvisor's working set calculation includes pages from the
filesystem cache that can (and will) be evicted before the OOM killer kills the
cgroup.

A container's RSS (anonymous memory usage) is still not precisely what the OOM
killer will use, but it's a better approximation of what the container's workload is
actually using. RSS metrics can, however, be dramatically inflated if a process in
the container uses MADV_FREE (lazy-free) memory. RSS will include the memory that is
available to be reclaimed without a page fault, but not currently in use.

The most common case of OOM kills is for anonymous memory demand to overwhelm the
container's memory limit. On swapless hosts, anonymous memory cannot be evicted from
the page cache, so when a container's memory usage is mostly anonymous pages, the
only remaining option to relieve memory pressure may be the OOM killer.

As container RSS approaches container memory limit, OOM kills become much more
likely. Consequently, this ratio is a good leading indicator of memory saturation
and OOM risk.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      container_memory_rss:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="ops",environment="ops",type="ops-gitlab-net"}
      /
      (container_spec_memory_limit_bytes:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="ops",environment="ops",type="ops-gitlab-net"} > 0)
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_container_rss component saturation: Kube Container Memory Utilization (RSS)

panels.description:
Measures Go memory usage as a percentage of container memory limit
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(env, environment, tier, type, stage, shard, cluster, pod) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      go_memstats_alloc_bytes{env="ops",environment="ops",type="ops-gitlab-net"}
      / on(env, environment, tier, type, stage, shard, cluster, pod) group_left()
      topk by(env, environment, tier, type, stage, shard, cluster, pod) (1,
        container_spec_memory_limit_bytes:labeled{container=~"gitlab-pages|gitlab-workhorse|kas|registry|thanos-store",env="ops",environment="ops",type="ops-gitlab-net"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_go_memory component saturation: Go Memory Utilization per Node

panels.description:
The [Horizontal Pod Autoscaler](https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/run-application/horizontal-pod-autoscale/)
automatically scales the number of Pods in a deployment based on metrics.

The Horizontal Pod Autoscaler has a configured upper maximum. When this
limit is reached, the HPA will not increase the number of pods and other
resource saturation (eg, CPU, memory) may occur.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard, horizontalpodautoscaler, shard) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      kube_horizontalpodautoscaler_status_desired_replicas:labeled{env="ops",environment="ops",type="ops-gitlab-net", shard!~"database-throttled|elasticsearch|gitaly-throttled|urgent-authorized-projects|urgent-other", namespace!~"pubsubbeat"}
      /
      kube_horizontalpodautoscaler_spec_max_replicas:labeled{env="ops",environment="ops",type="ops-gitlab-net", shard!~"database-throttled|elasticsearch|gitaly-throttled|urgent-authorized-projects|urgent-other", namespace!~"pubsubbeat"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_horizontalpodautoscaler_desired_replicas component saturation: Horizontal Pod Autoscaler Desired Replicas

panels.description:
Open file descriptor utilization per instance.

Saturation on file descriptor limits may indicate a resource-descriptor leak in the application.

As a temporary fix, you may want to consider restarting the affected process.
 Lower is better.
panels.title: open_fds component saturation: Open file descriptor utilization per instance
